chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 77-year-old man with acute liver failure (ALF) due to co-infection with Babesia microti and Borrelia burgdorferi. Lab results from the text and Table 1 show peak values: ALT 1421 U/L, AST 2656 U/L, total bilirubin 6.8 mg/dL, direct bilirubin 4.2 mg/dL, INR 3.5, and albumin 3.1 g/dL. ALP and GGT are not mentioned in the text or table, so they are null. The clinical outcome is death, as the patient died on hospital day five.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin 6.8 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin 4.2 mg/dL
